results.title: Nahanni
results.brief_description: The legend of a lost gold mine and a river in the Northwest Territories that lures men to their doom. Albert Faille, an aging prospector from Fort Simpson, has set out time after time to find hidden gold. His route is through a wild, awesome land particularly suited to the mood of this Canadian odyssey.

results.title: Nah - he was in a big house before (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Patricia Edgar, La Trobe University. Centre for the Study of Educational Communication and Media and Dave McRae
results.brief_description: The experiences of a teacher in his first year of teaching in a country high school. Investigates the town, the people, and the activities of the township, and then looks at the school and the problems concerning teachers in the school, with particular reference to his own experience in his first year. Written and directed by Dave McRae.

results.title: Nadja
results.creator_credit: Amy Hobby, Mary Sweeney, Kino Link Company and Michael Almereyda
results.brief_description:
Revisiting the vampire legend director/writer Michael Almereyda creates a modern day setting for several sexy undead creatures of the night. Elina Lowensohn plays the title role - a New York based vampire who is celebrating the demise of her father, and is hoping that her new life will encompass the attractive Lucy. Unfortunately Lucy is married to the nephew of a vampire hunter who is hell-bent on conquering Nadja. Aesthetically the film is an alluring mix of 35 mm footage and black-and-white, low-budget Pixelvision video. As an art film, the form is impressive but the narrative wanes at key moments, leaving an overall sense of a film that wavers inconsistently between a surrealist

Credits: Producer, Mary Sweeney, Amy Hobby ; director, writer, Michael Almereyda ; photography, Jim De Nault ; music, Simon Fisher Turner ; editing, David Leonard.
Cast: Elina Lowensohn, Suzy Amis, Galaxy Craze, Martin Donovan, Peter Fonda, Karl Geary.

results.title: Nadja
results.creator_credit: Kino Link Company, Mary Sweeney, Amy Hobby and Michael Almereyda
results.brief_description: Revisiting the vampire legend director/writer Michael Almereyda creates a modern day setting for several sexy undead creatures of the night. Elina Lowensohn plays the title role - a New York based vampire who is celebrating the demise of her father, and is hoping that her new life will encompass the attractive Lucy. Unfortunately Lucy is married to the nephew of a vampire hunter who is hell-bent on conquering Nadja. Aesthetically the film is an alluring mix of 35 mm footage and black-and-white, low-budget Pixelvision video. As an art film, the form is impressive but the narrative wanes at key moments, leaving an overall sense of a film that wavers inconsistently between a surrealist Lynchian vision and the deadpan humour of a Hal Hartley.

results.title: Nadar the great
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Pioneers of photography”.
Felix Nadar was a novelist, journalist, cartoonist, balloonist and the original for at least one Jules Verne hero. His photographs are a record of some of the most distinguished people of his time - Baudelaire, George Sand, Sarah Bernhadt and Offenbach.

results.title: Nabucco
results.creator_credit: Peter Butler, Opera Australia, ABC-TV (Australia) and Barrie Kosky
results.brief_description: Music by Giuseppe Verdi, libretto by Temistocle Solera after the play Nabucodonosor by Anicet-Bourgeois and Francis Cornue, Nabucco, based on the Old Testament story of Nebuchadnezzar, is a gripping tale of the Jewish people’s fight for survival and of the lust for power and abuse of it by both Nabucco and his adopted daughter, Abigaille. Directed by Barrie Kosky, this is a highly inventive and modern version of the opera. With his usual ecclecticism, Kosky mixes cabaret and pantomime with modern theatre and opera, creating an energetic and powerful production. Elizabeth Connell is outstanding as the ambitious Abigail and Jonathan Summers excellent as Nabucco. There’s a strong visual design by Peter Corrigan. Features singers Anson Austin (Ismaele), Rosemary Gunn (Fenena), Bruce Martin (Zaccaria), and The Australian Opera Chorus. Also features The State Orchestra of Victoria conducted by Carlo Felice Cillario. Recorded live at the State Theatre, Victorian Arts Centre on 7 May 1996 and produced for television in association with the Australian Broadcasting Corporation. Sung in Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: Nabucco
results.creator_credit: Renzo Giacchieri, Radiotelevisione Italiana, Polivideo and Brian Large
results.brief_description: This recorded production of Nabucco by Giuseppe Verdi, libretto by Temistocle Solera, was performed at the Arena di Verona in 1981. An opera, in four acts built around the king, Nebuchadnezzar and his two daughters and the defeated armies of the Hebrews and Levites, set in the spectacular open-air Roman arena and starring singers Renato Bruson (Nabucco), Ghena Dimitrova (Abigaille), Dimiter Petkov (Zaccaria), Bruna Baglioni (Fenena) and Ottavio Garaventa (Ismaele). Stage production by Renzo Giacchiere with the Chorus and Orchestra Arena di Verona conducted by Maurizio Arena. Sung in Italian. Includes a guide with English translation.

results.title: N.Y., N.Y.: a day in New York
results.brief_description: A portrait of the city from the predawn mists of the East River to the nighttime jazz of Broadway, a series of unique images is created from the familiar streets and sights of effects as floating buildings, horns that seem to undulate to the rhythm of their music, and cars and buses that stretch and weave. A kind of multiplication theme dominates in the film and shots rhythmically flow and change in a dance-like structure. Thompson says he “wanted to make fun of the ridiculousness of the life of a New Yorker.” He did, but his film goes further and describes the city’s diversity and its beauty as well. Music by Gene Forrell.

results.title: N-Zone
results.creator_credit: Tom Daly, ONF | NFB and Arthur Lipsett
results.brief_description: Arthur Lipsett pieces together his visions of this fragmented world from odds and ends, even leftovers, from other people’s photography and sound recording. By juxtaposing his snippets of “found film” with snatches of comment or dialogue echoing the banality of human communication, Lipsett shows the emptiness of much of what we say or do. Included is footage from the post-war Singapore hand over; radiation food testing; and the effects of radiation on animals. N-Zone is one man’s surrealist sampler of the human condition. Written by Arthur Lipsett and Henry Zemel. Photographed Arthur Lipsett, Henry Zemel, Paul Leach and Wolf Koenig. Edited by Arthur Lipsett.

results.title: Myxomatosis
results.brief_description: Produced to demonstrate to wool growers the best method of spreading the virus disease, Myxomatosis, among rabbits. The film surveys the extensive damage to pastures due to rabbit infestation and shows how the pest may be eradicated by the disease, fatal to rabbits, but harmless to farm animals and human beings. Recommended methods of spreading the disease are demonstrated; infection of healthy animals by the swab and inoculation methods; exposure of infected animal to mosquitoes; the spread of disease among the rabbit population of a district.
